items.title: Packers beat Commanders to maintain winning start
items.summary: The Green Bay Packers maintain their impressive start to the new NFL season by claiming a 27-18 win over the Washington Commanders.

items.title: Scheffler's sub-70 streak ends as Hughes leads
items.summary: Scottie Scheffler's streak of 21 sub-70 scores is over after he finishes the opening round of the Procore Championship seven shots behind leader Mackenzie Hughes.

items.title: 'They are the big dogs, we are the underdogs. A miracle can happen'
items.summary: South Africa number eight Aseza Hele has been a star of the Women's Rugby World Cup and plays on Saturday against New Zealand in her country's first quarter-final.

items.title: White in heated discussion with reporter over Muhammad Ali Act
items.summary: Dana White has a robust exchange with reporter Sean Zittel at the Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez v Terence Crawford news conference in Las Vegas, regarding the Muhammad Ali Act and the UFC CEO's venture into boxing.

items.title: Should Isak go straight in? The FPL talking point
items.summary: As the Premier League returns this weekend following the international break, is the time right to bring Alexander Isak into your FPL team, or is it too soon?

items.title: White in fiery exchange with reporter in Vegas
items.summary: UFC chief Dana White clashes with a reporter about his new role in boxing at a news conference for Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez v Terence Crawford.

items.title: Davis and Agyarko promise Windsor Park fireworks
items.summary: Ishmael Davis and Caoimhin Agyarko say their light-middleweight meeting will be the "fight of the night" at Windsor Park on Saturday.

items.title: Ulster GAA need concrete plan for Casement - Lyons
items.summary: Gordon Lyons has said he unable to move forward on Casement Park until there is "more certainty" on plans from Ulster GAA.

items.title: Lenovo Coupon Codes and Deals: Up to $500 Off
items.summary: Whether youâ€™re shopping for a ThinkPad, Yoga laptop, or Legion gaming PC, these Lenovo discount codes and promotions can help you save big on your next tech upgrade.

items.title: GB hope to avoid 'FA Cup giant-killing' in Davis Cup
items.summary: Great Britain's Davis Cup tie in Poland feels like a Premier League side being drawn away to a non-league team in the third round of the FA Cup - but it's one they must win, writes Russell Fuller.

items.title: Me or Garnacho? Rooney decides on superior bicycle kick
items.summary: Before the Manchester derby, Wayne Rooney, Kelly Somers, Kae Kurd and Shaun Wright-Phillips debate the better goal - Rooney's bicycle kick against Manchester City or Alejandro Garnacho's v Everton?

items.title: Why Rooney partied with Man City players after 6-1 derby humiliation
items.summary: Wayne Rooney has been involved in plenty of Manchester derby moments - both good and bad - and he discusses them in his BBC podcast.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

items.title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
items.summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

items.title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
items.summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.
